repository.corpname: Connecticut Polish American Archives, Elihu Burritt Library, Central Connecticut State University

did.abstract: Collection consists of personal papers of Mr. Bronislaw Krzyzewski, a World War I veteran of the Polish Army under General Jozef Haller in France and later in Poland.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mr. Bronislaw Krzyzewski was born in town of Suwalki in northeastern Poland in 1896. He came to the United States on May 21, 1914. Four years later on February 25, 1918 he volunteered together with other Poles and Polish Americans to join the Polish Army, which was being formed in France under General Jozef Haller . Mr. Krzyzewski left for France in March of 1918. World War I ended in November 1918. However, he did not return to the US but, together with the Haller's Army left for Poland in April of 1919 to fight for Poland's independence. At this time, he visited his home town of Suwalki. Mr. Krzyzewski came back to the US on January 28, 1921. For his participation in the WWI in the Haller's Army he received a medal. Mr. Krzyzewski lived in Willimantic, Connecticut most of his life and he died there in November of 1977.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of personal notes and photographs of Mr. Bronislaw Krzyzewski. Personal notes include dates of his travel during WWI and text of polish religious and patriotic songs. Collection also includes some family information and handwritten notes on family members.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cite as: Bronislaw Krzyzewski Papers (CPAA 07-12). Connecticut Polish American Archives, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For related material on World War I and the General Haller's Army see: Urbanski, Michael T. "Money, war, and recruiting an army: the activities of Connecticut Polonia during World War I." Connecticut History, 46 no. 1 ( 2007): 45-69.

acqinfo.p: Donated by Mrs. Camille Chmura daughter of Mr. Krzyzewski in November 2007.

did.unittitle: Memoir in Polish with raw English translation, kept by Mr. Krzyzewski during WWI in Poland.
Medal given to Mr. Krzyzewski for his participation in WWI with Haller's Army; he received the medal in 1921.
Two (2) photographs of Mr. Krzyzewski during his hospital stay in Rowne, Wolyn province, taken Sep. 2, 1919
Prayer book in Polish with a hand written notes: "This book was purchased in Suwalki in 1919"; "Souvenir from Suwalki after 6 years of absence in this town."
5 postcards from Suwalki: 4 postcards from 1915 and 1 from 1920 with Russian army equipment.
Post card from relative in Poland; obituary of Michal Mazierz, brother in law with additional family info.
Polish post card to Woodrow Wilson with a poem in honor of President Wilson and his role in Poland's independence.
Leather wallet, traveling pouch from Bremen, Germany to the US.
Map of Poland, printed by Polish Daily Zgoda.
